description:
nova/doc/source/devref/development.environment.rst has a section that discusses tools/install_venv.py;
that section says this script installs the dependencies in requirements.txt but does not clearly
say that the dependencies in test-requirements are also installed.

This bug appears in nova at the start of Jan 7, 2014 UTC.
title: nova's development.environment.rst has inadequate description of tools/install_venv.py

comments.author: https://api.launchpad.net/1.0/~mike-spreitzer

comments.content:
Fix proposed to branch: master
Review: https://review.openstack.org/65235
comments.author: https://api.launchpad.net/1.0/~hudson-openstack

comments.content:
Reviewed:  https://review.openstack.org/65235
Committed: https://git.openstack.org/cgit/openstack/nova/commit/?id=1ad28b5a0282dbbd880eacf0efdf33d5921163d8
Submitter: Jenkins
Branch:    master

commit 1ad28b5a0282dbbd880eacf0efdf33d5921163d8
Author: Mike Spreitzer <email address hidden>
Date:   Tue Jan 7 03:07:30 2014 -0500

    Updated development.environment.rst
    
    Enhanced the discussion of tools/install_venv.py to say that it
    installs the items listed in test-requirements.txt as well as
    those listed in requirements.txt.
    
    Re-wrapped the relevant paragraph.
    
    Since the change to delete run_tests.sh and tools/install_venv.py
    (https://review.openstack.org/#/c/76627/)
    has been abandoned, the doc of install_venv.py should still be
    accurate.
    
    Change-Id: I5cfd9f179f40b2418129067d0940bfdbf47512cb
    Closes-Bug: #1266671
comments.author: https://api.launchpad.net/1.0/~hudson-openstack
